LanguageData.TD.SettingNearby: ... But use nearby medicine (if same quality)
LanguageData.TD.SettingNearbyDesc: This also checks for medicine on the way to the patient (roughly based on distance, not actual path)
LanguageData.TD.SettingNearbyDist: How far to walk to find nearby medicine
LanguageData.TD.SettingNearbyDistDesc: This is only an override for inventory medicine - if there is no inventory medicine, they will walk to the ends of the map to pick up medicine
LanguageData.TD.SettingOtherInv: Drop medicine from nearby colonist's inventory
LanguageData.TD.SettingAnimalInv: Drop medicine from nearby animal's inventory
LanguageData.TD.SettingOtherAnyDistDesc: Check to use better medicine from someone else far away, but at the cost of walking to it
LanguageData.TD.SettingOtherDist: How far to walk to get it
LanguageData.TD.SettingMinimal: Use minimal medicine for non-urgent care
LanguageData.TD.SettingMinimalDesc: Urgent care is any disease, or injuries with bleeding, infection chance, or permanent effects - save valuable medicine for these only
LanguageData.TD.SettingNoMedDesc: Same as above, but without medicine, each injury is treated one at a time
LanguageData.TD.SettingMedicineGoodEnough: ... include medicine that is good enough:
LanguageData.TD.SettingStockUpDesc: Stock Up settings are in the colonist's Gear Tab
LanguageData.TD.SettingFieldTendingNoBeds: Doctors will treat patients if no beds are available
LanguageData.TD.SettingFieldTendingNoBedsDesc: The patient must be resting, downed, or drafted to target
LanguageData.TD.SettingFieldTendingAlways: Doctors can always tend, with or without a bed
LanguageData.TD.SettingFieldTendingAlwaysDesc: Colonists will prioritize going to a bed, but you may draft patients to keep them in place.
LanguageData.TD.SettingsMedicineGoodEnoughDesc: For example, if Herbal Medicine does 90% as good a job as Normal, use Herbal instead
LanguageData.TD.SettingStockUpEnough: Stock Up only if there's enough available:
LanguageData.TD.SettingStockUpEnoughDesc: For example, at 150%, Stockpiles need to have enough for everyone to stock up to 100%, plus 50% extra
LanguageData.TD.SettingStockUpReturn: Return items if not enough available
LanguageData.TD.NotEnoughStockUp: Not enough available to stock up
LanguageData.TD.SettingGlobalSurgeryUnlimited: Default medical settings for a new game have 'surgery use best' checked
LanguageData.TD.SettingGlobalSurgeryUnlimitedDesc: During a game, this setting is not used - the default for new colonists is alongside the other medical defaults accessible in the Health tab
LanguageData.TD.RemoveTempTendDesc: Remove this (in case it lingers around after it's unused)
